img.title: Inside PCS: Petaluma City Schools News - Header
img.alt: Inside PCS: Petaluma City Schools News - Header

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Casa Grande and Petaluma High exteriors

a.span: 2 Petaluma Teams Set To Battle In North Bay Academic Decathlon

div.p: Teams from Casa Grande High School and Petaluma High School are set to compete against teams from 14 other schools across six counties in the North Bay Region's Academic Decathlon.

a.title: Go to comments for 2 Petaluma Teams Set To Battle In North Bay Academic Decathlon

img.alt: Grant elementary students plant native grass in Shollenberger Park

a.span: Helping something other than ourselves: Petaluma kids save wetlands

div.p: Second graders at Grant Elementary participate in Point Blue Conservation Science's STRAW program and get hands-on environmental education with a field trip to Shollenberger Park. [Photo courtesy of Crissy Pascual/Argus-Courier]

a.title: Go to comments for Helping something other than ourselves: Petaluma kids save wetlands

a.span: Violet Wang of Casa Grande Named Delegate for 2020 U.S. Senate Youth Program

div.p: Congratulations to Violet Wang of Casa Grande High School on being named as a delegate for the 2020 U.S. Senate Youth Program!

a.title: Go to comments for Violet Wang of Casa Grande Named Delegate for 2020 U.S. Senate Youth Program

div.h1: Stay Connected with the PCS Mobile App

p.img: Customize your settings to receive push notifications, follow newsfeeds, and receive important information from any school or the district, all in one user-friendly interface.

a.title: Download PCS Mobile app with Apple App Store
Download PCS Mobile app with Google Play

div.p:
Address Petaluma City Schools
200 Douglas Street, Petaluma, CA 94952

div.span: NON-DISCRIMINATION: Petaluma City Schools is committed to providing equal opportunity for all individuals in district programs and activities. District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, including discrimination against an individual or group based on race, color, ancestry, nationality, national origin, immigration status, ethnic group identification, ethnicity, age, religion, marital status, pregnancy, or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or genetic information; a perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.

NON-DISCRIMINATION: Petaluma City Schools is committed to providing equal opportunity for all individuals in district programs and activities. District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, including discrimination against an individual or group based on race, color, ancestry, nationality, national origin, immigration status, ethnic group identification, ethnicity, age, religion, marital status, pregnancy, or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or genetic information; a perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.
